definitions.definition: A philosophical belief in the existence of a god (or goddess ) knowable through human reason; especially, a belief in a creator god unaccompanied by any belief in supernatural phenomena or specific religious doctrines.
Belief in a god who ceased to intervene with existence after acting as the cause of the cosmos.

main_definition: ( philosophy ) A philosophical belief in the existence of a god (or goddess ) knowable through human reason; especially, a belief in a creator god unaccompanied by any belief in supernatural phenomena or specific religious doctrines.
secondary_definitions: Belief in a god who ceased to intervene with existence after acting as the cause of the cosmos.
